Package com.github.ds67.jminicache.impl.guard

Interface GuardIF

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalGuard, ReadWriteGuard, SimpleLockGuard
    public interface GuardIF
    Interface to define a synchronization guard. Provides functions to lock for read usage (multiple read request in parallel) or write usage ( a single write at a time). However, depending on the used eviction policy a read request to the cache will result in a write lock as the background datastructes require reorganization upon every request Therefore different implementations are provided.
    Author:
    Jens Ketterer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void lockRead()
      Locks the guard for read purposes.
      void lockWrite()
      Locks the guard for write purposes.
      void promoteLock()
      Promoted an existing read lock to an write lock.
      default void readLocked​(Runnable f)
      Executes a supplied function in a read locked context.
      default <R> R readLocked​(Supplier<R> f)
      Executes a supplied function in a read locked context.
      void unlockRead()  
      void unlockWrite()  
      default void writeLocked​(Runnable f)
      Executes a supplied function in a read locked context.
      default <R> R writeLocked​(Supplier<R> f)
      Executes a supplied function in a write locked context.
      void yield()
      Can be called when there is a long lasting lock.

    • Method Detail

      • lockRead

        void lockRead()
        Locks the guard for read purposes. Waits until a read lock can be aquired.

      • lockWrite

        void lockWrite()
        Locks the guard for write purposes. Waits until a write lock can be aquired.

      • unlockRead

        void unlockRead()

      • unlockWrite

        void unlockWrite()

      • promoteLock

        void promoteLock()
        Promoted an existing read lock to an write lock. Might wait until other readers unlock.

      • yield

        void yield()
        Can be called when there is a long lasting lock. When other threads wait for lock aquiring these threads will be preferred executed. After these executions the current write lock is reestablished. Must not be implemented by every guard

      • readLocked

        default void readLocked​(Runnable f)
        Executes a supplied function in a read locked context. Ensures that the lock is released after the function is called even when exceptions occur.
        Parameters:
        f - function which is called in a read lock context

      • readLocked

        default <R> R readLocked​(Supplier<R> f)
        Executes a supplied function in a read locked context. Ensures that the lock is released after the function is called even when exceptions occur.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Return type of the supplied function
        Parameters:
        f - function which is called in a read lock context
        Returns:
        the result of the supplier function f

      • writeLocked

        default <R> R writeLocked​(Supplier<R> f)
        Executes a supplied function in a write locked context. Ensures that the lock is released after the function is called even when exceptions occur.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Return type of the supplied function
        Parameters:
        f - function which is called in a write lock context
        Returns:
        the result of the supplier function f

      • writeLocked

        default void writeLocked​(Runnable f)
        Executes a supplied function in a read locked context. Ensures that the lock is released after the function is called even when exceptions occur.
        Parameters:
        f - procedure which is called in a write lock context
